column5: The context in which this is being discussed involves adults and the way in which you expressed your point seemed as though you were a proponent of later in life violence to facilitate some kind of citizen mandated justice, itâ€™s impossible to target the children of racist parents which is generally who will be rearing these kids but that would result in more hatred I think, The solution (I think broadly) lies in exposure to those minority groups and thorough interaction to form an educated opinion (which if the individual is open minded and patient will result in recognition of commonality) it just seems like too simple of a solution for a complex issue involving generationally metastasized prejudice. I donâ€™t mean to be invalidating I was just curious on my end and donâ€™t really understand the format of implementation for your suggestion. I just think hurting people is a bad way of enforcing healthy lasting change.  Thanks for taking the time to reply.
